FacilityName: ABC Compounding Co. Of Texas Inc.

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Polish and Other Sanitation Good Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Name: ABC Compounding Co. of Texas Inc.

EPA Facility ID#: 1000 0015 5431



Executive Summary



ABC Compounding CO. of Texas Inc. is a manufacturer of janitorial

and sanitary supply cleaners and related chemicals products.  As

such, safety during all phases of this process is of utmost

importance to the ownership, senior management, supervisors, and

employees.  Continual monitoring is performed by management and

staff on both, process and personnel, to assure a satisfactory

level of safety is being achieved.  Any condition found suspect

is analyzed and corrected.  ABC periodically trains employees as

to the safe handling of chemicals and machinery.  Departure from

established safety practices by an employee is not tolerated.



As mentioned previously, ABC is involved in the business of

manufacturing and distributing various cleaners and related

products.  Our facility is located within the bounds of the Great

Southwest Industrial district in Grand Prairie, Texas.  Our

50,000 square feet plant sits upon approximately four acres.  We

package the cleaners into aerosol cans of various sizes.  A

variety of chemicals, both hazardous and non-hazardous, are used

in producing the cleaners and other compounds.  Of particular

concern to the EPA per section 112(r) of the Clean Air Act is the

storage and usage of approximately two thousand to sixteen

thousand gallons of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG).  These gases

are stored in liquid form by pressurization in two certified nine

thousand gallon capacity vessels located on the back lot of the

property.  They come in two blends, known generically as A-85 and

A-46.  These blends are naturally occurring hydrocarbons used as

the aerosol propellant.



The worst case release scenario in regards to the LPG vessels

would be the total release and ignition of the hydrocarbon

blends.  The resulting explosion would have an off-site impact of

approximately 0.3 mile radius.  This is based upon the RMP

c

omputer model provided by the EPA.  ABC, with the counsel and

recommendations of the Texas Railroad Commission, and local fire

department has installed hardware and safety systems making the

worst case scenario highly unlikely.  The above ground vessels

with LPG are certified and periodically inspected for integrity

and leaks.  Any signs of potential problems are immediately

repaired.   All pumps and associated switches used in transfer

process are explosion proof.  Emergency shut off switches are

strategically located, allowing for quick shutdown of the vessel

pumps.  High flow water canons surround the vessel and will be

used to deluge the vessels with water to keep them cool in the

event of an encroaching fire.  Extensive training and care is

used in the area of LPG transfer.



ABC Compounding has demonstrated compliance with Process Safety

Management.  Thorough analyses of the LPG vessels, process,

technology and equipment have been conducted.  Daily visual and

audible inspections are performed on the vessels and piping to

detect any possible leaks.  If any are found, they repaired

immediately.



There have been no accidents or releases with respect to the LPG

vessels in the previous ten years, nor in the years before.



The emergency response program at ABC Compounding begins at the

ground level with our employees.  A team of qualified personnel

have trained in the area of detection and correction of an

accidental release of LPG.  A local emergency response company,

Protect Environmental Service, Inc., is on contact to respond to

any large release of LPG that may occur.  Periodic inspections

and education is provided by the local fire department.  Material

Safety Data Sheets have been provided to the local fire

department in the event of a release and the Local Emergency

Planning Committee has been sent all required information

including the Texas Tier II.



ABC Compounding is constantly participating in any pertinent

safety or

instructional training offered by various

organizations.  In house inspections often lead to changes in

methods or equipment used in the LPG process as well as other

areas.  The hazards of LPG and its transfer are certainly

recognized by ABC Compounding.  As a result, it is treated with

respect.  We are proud of our safety record and intend to

continue the high level of vigilance required to maintain a safe

operating environment for our employees and neighbors.
